episodeTitle: It Repels Everything! Kuma's Paw-Paw Power!
episodeTitleJapanese: すべてを弾く くまのニキュニキュの能力
episodeTitleRomanized: Subete o Hajiku Kuma no Nikyu Nikyu no Chikara
description: Bartholomew Kuma reveals his overwhelming Nikyu Nikyu no Mi powers as he effortlessly defeats the exhausted Straw Hat Pirates. After offering to spare them in exchange for Luffy, Kuma unleashes his devastating Ursus Shock attack that destroys most of Thriller Bark when they refuse.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Zoro Challenges Kuma
events.description: Despite being exhausted from the battle with Oars and Moria, Zoro steps forward to confront Bartholomew Kuma. He attempts to strike Kuma with his swords, but all of his attacks are effortlessly repelled.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the Straw Hats' desperate battle against an overwhelmingly powerful Warlord, demonstrating the vast gap in strength between them and the World Government's forces.

events.title: Kuma Reveals the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi
events.description: Bartholomew Kuma reveals that he has eaten the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi (Paw-Paw Fruit), a Paramecia-type Devil Fruit that allows him to repel anything with the paw pads on his hands. He demonstrates this ability by effortlessly deflecting all of Zoro's attacks and repelling air at high speed.
events.significance: This is the first full reveal of Kuma's Devil Fruit powers, establishing him as one of the most formidable opponents the Straw Hats have faced. The versatile nature of his ability to repel anything makes him nearly invincible in combat.

quotes.text: I ate the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi. I'm a Paw Human who can repel anything.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma reveals his Devil Fruit ability to the Straw Hats

events.title: Kuma's Puni Technique
events.description: Kuma demonstrates his ability to repel objects and attacks by using his paw pads. The technique shows the basic application of his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi powers, deflecting sword strikes and physical attacks with ease.
events.significance: This establishes the fundamental mechanics of Kuma's Devil Fruit ability and shows how he can defend against any direct assault.

events.title: Franky Attacks Kuma
events.description: Franky, underestimating Kuma's abilities, launches an attack against the Warlord. However, Kuma effortlessly defeats Franky with a single strike from his paw, sending him flying.
events.significance: This demonstrates that even the physically powerful members of the Straw Hat crew are no match for Kuma in their exhausted state, further emphasizing the hopelessness of their situation.

events.title: Sanji and Usopp Join the Fight
events.description: Sanji and Usopp enter the battle to help save Zoro and the crew. Despite their combined efforts, their attacks prove completely ineffective against Kuma's repelling abilities.
events.significance: The continued defeats show that multiple Straw Hats working together still cannot overcome Kuma's overwhelming power, building tension and desperation.

events.title: Tsuppari Pad Ho Debut
events.description: Kuma uses Tsuppari Pad Ho, a technique where he thrusts his paw pads forward in rapid succession to attack his opponents. The attack demonstrates another application of his repelling powers in offensive combat.
events.significance: This shows that Kuma's Devil Fruit is not just defensive but can be used for devastating offensive techniques as well.

events.title: Kuma Creates the Ursus Shock Air Bomb
events.description: Kuma begins compressing a massive amount of air between his paws, using his repelling ability to compress it over and over. The air forms a small, dense paw-shaped bubble that contains enormous destructive power. This compressed air bomb is the setup for his ultimate technique, Ursus Shock.
events.significance: This is the first appearance of one of Kuma's most devastating attacks. The visual of the compressed air bomb and the tension as it forms creates one of the most memorable moments in the Thriller Bark arc.

events.title: Kuma's Ultimatum: Surrender Luffy or Die
events.description: Kuma offers the Straw Hats and their allies a choice: surrender Monkey D. Luffy to the World Government and he will spare everyone else's lives. He explains that the World Government wants no witnesses to Moria's defeat, as it would damage the reputation of the Warlords.
events.significance: This ultimatum puts the Straw Hats in an impossible position, testing their loyalty to their captain. Their response will define their resolve and commitment to each other as a crew.

quotes.text: If you hand over Straw Hat Luffy's head, I can let the rest of you live.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Kuma offers to spare the crew in exchange for Luffy

events.title: The Straw Hats Refuse to Surrender Luffy
events.description: Despite being exhausted, injured, and facing certain death, the Straw Hat Pirates unanimously refuse to surrender their captain to Kuma. They stand defiant, willing to die rather than betray Luffy.
events.significance: This moment epitomizes the bond between the Straw Hat crew members and their unwavering loyalty to their captain. It's a defining character moment that shows they would rather die together than abandon one of their own.

events.title: Ursus Shock Devastates Thriller Bark
events.description: After the Straw Hats refuse his offer, Kuma unleashes Ursus Shock by releasing the compressed air bomb. The massive paw-shaped explosion engulfs all of Thriller Bark, causing catastrophic damage to the island. The shockwave is powerful enough to destroy buildings, uproot trees, and knock out nearly everyone on the island, including most of the Straw Hat Pirates and their allies. Only Zoro and Sanji remain conscious after the devastating attack.
events.significance: Ursus Shock is one of the most visually spectacular and devastating attacks in One Piece up to this point. It demonstrates the true power gap between the Straw Hats and the World Government's forces, and sets up the iconic sacrifice that follows in the next episode. This attack represents the lowest point for the crew in the Thriller Bark arc.

events.title: World Government's Cover-Up Revealed
events.description: Through Kuma's statements, it's revealed that the World Government wants to eliminate all witnesses to Gecko Moria's defeat. The government fears that news of another Warlord being defeated would undermine the authority and reputation of the Seven Warlords system.
events.significance: This reveals the political machinations of the World Government and how they manipulate information to maintain their power structure. It shows that the Warlord system is more fragile than it appears and that the government will go to extreme lengths to preserve its image.

quotes.text: I ate the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi. I'm a Paw Human who can repel anything.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma

quotes.text: If you hand over Straw Hat Luffy's head, I can let the rest of you live.
quotes.speaker: Bartholomew Kuma
quotes.context: Offering the Straw Hats an ultimatum

themes.description: The episode explores the unwavering loyalty of the Straw Hat Pirates to their captain, as they refuse to surrender Luffy even when faced with certain death.
themes.symbolism: The crew's refusal to betray Luffy symbolizes the strength of their bonds and their willingness to sacrifice everything for each other.

themes.description: Kuma's effortless dominance over the entire Straw Hat crew demonstrates the vast power gap between them and the World Government's top forces.
themes.symbolism: The Ursus Shock serves as a visual representation of how far the Straw Hats still have to grow to compete at the highest levels of the One Piece world.

themes.description: The revelation that the World Government wants to eliminate all witnesses to maintain the Warlord system's reputation shows the lengths they'll go to preserve their power.
themes.symbolism: Kuma as an agent of government cover-ups represents the darker side of the World Government's operations.

characterSpotlights.development: Kuma is revealed to possess one of the most versatile and powerful Devil Fruits seen thus far. His stoic demeanor and efficient execution of orders paint him as an enigmatic and nearly unstoppable force serving the World Government.
keyActions: Reveals Nikyu Nikyu no Mi powers
Effortlessly defeats Zoro, Franky, Sanji, and Usopp
Demonstrates Puni, Tsuppari Pad Ho, and Ursus Shock techniques
Destroys most of Thriller Bark with Ursus Shock
quotes: I ate the Nikyu Nikyu no Mi. I'm a Paw Human who can repel anything.
If you hand over Straw Hat Luffy's head, I can let the rest of you live.

characterSpotlights.role: Primary defender attempting to protect the crew
characterSpotlights.development: Despite being exhausted from previous battles, Zoro immediately steps up to fight Kuma, showing his role as the crew's protector. His inability to land a single hit on Kuma demonstrates the harsh reality of their current limitations.
keyActions: Remains conscious after Ursus Shock along with Sanji
Sets up for his legendary sacrifice in the next episode

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several fight sequences between the Straw Hats and Kuma, adding more animation of their futile attacks being repelled.
The anime added additional shots of the destruction caused by Ursus Shock, showing more detailed aftermath of the explosion across Thriller Bark.

trivia.fact: This episode has an IMDb rating of 9.1 out of 10, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the Thriller Bark arc.
The episode's Japanese TV rating was 8.4%, ranking 6th in its timeslot for the week it aired.

The opening theme for this episode, 'We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)' performed by Tohoshinki (TVXQ), is a special cover of the series' original opening to celebrate the anime's 10th anniversary.
Ursus Shock (ウルススショック) means 'Bear Impact' in Latin, fitting with Kuma's name which means 'bear' in Japanese.
This episode sets up one of the most iconic moments in One Piece history: Zoro's sacrifice in Episode 377, which is often cited by fans as one of the best moments in the entire series.
